title: Firefox Password Manager
content:
I've been using Firefox for a long time, several years, and recently have been accessing some feature that looks like a password manager on my laptop, called Lock <something>--actually I'm not sure what it's called, because I can't seem to bring it up on its own to locate my password info.

I believe in password managers, and I'm trying to move over there, but I've run into a big snag on my mobile Android device... I have no idea how to bring up my Gettr account on my Android because I don't know where the password that I configured for my Gettr account on my laptop is located. I know it's inside the Firefox password manager somewhere... then I see Lockwise is no longer being supported.

Ultimately I want to synch whatever Firefox's latest password manager is to my Android, so that it functions like "whatever Firefox's latest password manager is" for my laptop. I'd like to synch my bookmarks, too. Can anyone point me to some simple instructions? Thanks. I'm using a primary password now for Firefox on my laptop. My email address is brian_r_wright@yahoo.com.

Brian Wright

title: Firefox doesn't recognize FQDN when saving password for website
content:
Hello, I've had this issue for a long time but now it actually bugged me enough to ask about it.

Let's say I have an app with one set of credentials at https://website1.xyz.com

I also have another web app at https://webmail.xyz.com

Firefox only offers to remember credentials for xyz.com so whenever i access any of those websites above i have to juggle between credentials.

Is it possible for firefox to remember passwords separate for whole FQDN?

title: Audio stops working on Firefox 95.0.2 after a few days
content:
I've been teaching my young daughter how to use a computer, and we chose firefox as a browser she can use to do some things online - in particular she's been doing Math lessons using https://www.themathsfactor.com

After the past few weeks I've noticed that sound from that site no longer seems to work after 1 or 2 days. Embedded videos work, but sound where the site has a character that tells her what to do - stops working. If I restart the browser it starts working again - however refreshing the page does not. This is something recent, as older versions of firefox did not seem to do this. I'm wondering if there is some change/memory leak that might cause this?
creator: 365nice

title: Which FF profile folders can be excluded from backup ?
content:
I am currently excluding from my backup script all the folders listed in the first group, but I wonder if folders in the second group or even others not listed can also be excluded.

Group 1

  • Firefox\cache2
  • Firefox\datareporting
  • Firefox\jumpListCache
  • Firefox\minidumps
  • Firefox\shader-cache
  • Firefox\shortcutCache

Group 2

  • Firefox\personality-provider
  • Firefox\safebrowsing
  • Firefox\startupCache
  • Firefox\storage
  • Firefox\thumbnails
  • Firefox\weave


Any advice is appreciated. Thank you.

title: Tabs have disappeared, and I'm having trouble restoring them.
content:
I finished using a given webpage and wanted to close it. The webpage's tab was at the end of the tab bar, but I accidentally pushed the 'X' on the top bar. I then attempted to re-open Firebox by pushing the Firebox icon on the taskbar. I did not get anything restored. I had many tabs that I was using for my research. I then remembered that Firefox did not warn me that I was closing an 'x' number of tabs, as it has done in the past.

I then checked my settings and the box for warning the user that s/he is closing so many tabs was not checked. I know I had it checked. Then I remembered that there was a recent update of Firefox, and I had this happen before when there were updates. I did not think of checking this setting with the recent update, because this was not a problem in recent times. Indeed, when I went to settings, the check had been removed by Firefox.

How do I get my tabs back?
creator: wp46
